intro: Metastelma aemulans, commonly known as the false spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, which are followed by bright red berries. Metastelma aemulans is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
